conclusion: Analyze the relationships between terminal voltage U and current I for the battery and resistance R.
Line a represents the battery's terminal voltage U as a function of current I. Voltage U decreases as current I increases.
Line b represents the resistance R as a function of current I. Voltage U remains constant as I increases.
Voltage U across the battery must equal the voltage U across the resistance R in a closed loop.
From the graph, voltage U across the battery is 2.5 V when current I is 0.2 A.
Voltage U across the resistance R is 2.5 V.
Since voltages are equal, the internal resistance R of the silicon photocell is 2.5 V.
Since the internal resistance R is constant, the internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 2.5 V.
The problem involves understanding voltage-current relationships to determine internal resistance of silicon photocell in a closed loop.
Since voltages are equal, internal resistance R is directly given by voltage U across the resistance.
From the graph, voltage U across resistance R is 2.5 V, matching internal resistance of silicon photocell.
Thus, the internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 2.5 V.
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 2.5 V.
